reviews.text: Excellent a myst place to visit

Good location food is also good. Good location for people watching. Host is friendly, $1 draught beer. For people who don't watch to sit at the 50 cent beer places. I never stayed here but I never heard anything bad about bokor mountain lodge. They have good live music in the high season.
Scenic views

Rundown place, badly maintained. Awful food. Seemed heated up for us- definitely not freshly cooked. Many items on the menu not available. Once order was taken many accompanying items were not served citing invailability. Such simple things like chips at that. 

Though the serving staff was pleasant, it was the worst food experience of Cambodia.  Best avoided. 

Only the toilet was passable. 

Avoid if possible.

Bokor Mountain is a beautiful mountain. We can see the sea, villages, jungles, sunset, sunrise and so much more on the mountaintop. We can catch the cloud too. On the street to the mountaintop we can see the flowers and thick jungles with the beautiful street. If you want to see the great views, don't forget to go there.
Very interesting free tours explaining the whole process and the differences between all kind of peppers. You can also see a demo farm on the outside.

Interesting place and friendly staff. The lady told us many stories about the pepper and cambodia life. Interestingly this is set up as a co-op program, there are 100s of smaller (cambodian) farms that are aggregated and marketed and exported under their brand. Ask them about the serial number codes on the vac bags for some insight. I did not purchase here as it didn't seem I was going to get a great price, but you might do better, and its worth stopping in for a chat considering its proximity to the town.
Great place to buy real Kampot pepper to local producers.
Guys here specialize in best Kampot Pepper. You got to visit here for trade inquiries and business relations.
Excellent place to learn more about the famous kampot pepper. Easy to walk from kampot town !

The guesthouse is alright. The rooms are big, the beds comfortable, the AC works, there is hot water in shower. But other than that it's expensive for what you get ($15 for AC room, $8 for fan only, the difference being the remote control for AC, yet I was told "all the fan rooms are gone"). There is no toiletries provided, I had some remains of toilet paper in the room. The toilet seat wasn't attached to the toilet. The flush was broken. The door lock was difficult to operate. The WiFi was slow. Clearly, no-one cares about maintaining the rooms. The bathroom was all splashed in water when I checked in. The sink was clogged.
Incredibly nice staff. Really go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable

Best overall and versatile resto in that part of town. Good value for money, western and Khmer dishes are equally good. It's always full and their open seating with a strategic corner position is spot on. I especially loved their Fish Amok, an explosion of taste in your mouth!
Wonderful stay. The staff were fantastic, and the room was great. Very cheap stay, even free laundry service. Really would recommend
Very, very good khmer and asia food, especially pumpkin soup. And cheap as well, definitely recommend it.
Mate and I had ice cream which was perfect for a hot day treat. Loved it so much we came back later for brownies. Brownies were fudgey, thick, and delicious!

They actually do a decent English breakfast! Well recommended. And have HP sauce!

Edit: the cinnamon rolls are lovely.

We googled this place looking for a place to take our 4 small kids, and we were not disappointed. There are big heavy tables outside for large families that can't be tipped over by squirmy 5 year olds! The dessert are amazing and very inexpensive. Our 2 year old got hurt by her older brother once and the staff quickly offered ice to help us, they were very friendly! This is our 2nd time here and love it.

I’m still sitting here basking in the afterglow of a perfect brownie and vanilla scoop and felt compelled to write this. My god it was delicious - brownie was warm and rich and ice cream tasted homemade - can’t even think of a place I’ve ever been to that tops that .
Nice fresh ice-cream. They have many choices.

A review not about ribs...I had the burger and it was quite delicious! Came with a good serving of fries and coleslaw (which you should put on the burger, yum!) Only disappointment was that it wasn’t more crowded. I went on a Saturday night hoping to throw a few back but it was dead! Might be my mistake that it’s really more of a restaurant than bar.

All in all, it's a place you can recommend for dinner, but don't go there with the highest expectations. It changed a lot since they moved to the riverside. Obviously, it's really nice to eat dinner while watching the sunset but the quality of the staff really dropped. Some staff is really nice and welcoming, but on the other hand some are really not interested at all in you and your wishes. The so called ribs aren't really ribs but for Cambodia the meat you get is still good and enjoyable meat. Cocktails are quite cheap and good looking. The prices are alright in the end.

Nice place on the river. Ordered full rack of ribs here, but it's not actually ribs but piece of meat on rib bones. Nice marinade but chewy meat. Hardly could eat it for two persons. Use mosquito repellent if you go here at evening.

So let me set the scene. It's evening. I'm hungry. Really hungry. My buddy and I roll up to this place, because we have on really good authority that the ribs are, and I quote, "the best in Cambodia". Now I sit down, and see they have "Dino BBQ Ribs Challenge" as a menu item.

Well, well - 2kg of ribs and a side. Sounded like enough to satisfy the hunger clawing at my belly.

The ribs arrive. They're huge. Like, really, really huge. The picture doesn't do them justice. I dig in. In the middle of pulling hunk after hunk of meat off the ribs, I drop morsel on the ground. The challenge required that I eat all the meat - seeing as the floor was *spotless* (and I hadn't yet violated the 5 second rule), I swallowed the piece along with my dignity.

Now, here's my honest run-down of these ribs. The meat near the bones was A++. Yes, that's a double plus, not a typo. Really awesome meat, tender, total flavor bomb. Now, moving away from ribs, the meat was kind of dry and a little tough, but to be totally honest, it's got to be super hard to find a chunk of meat that size and cook it evenly all the way through and have it retain it's tenderness.

Now, 45 minutes into the challenge, my jaw is literally cramping up from the sheer amount of meat I've eaten. I'm bursting at the seams. I force myself forward, but full disclosure, I got my butt kicked and ended up on the Wall of Shame.

Well played, Rusty Keyhole. Killer food, A++ (nope, that's also not a typo) experience. I'd come back in the blink of an eye.
We can enjoy the cool air of Kampot River.

The brownie was amazing! Lovely people who run it too. Definitely stop by c
for breakfast or just for some cake!

First decent brownie I've been able to find. $1 but fairly small. Texture halfway between a gooey brownie and a cake, so if you're looking for a really gooey brownie, this isn't it, but it was pretty good.
Super tasty pancakes, sandwiches with homemade bread and fair prices I love this place!

Food was only ok. Really slow service. Ordered veg omelette and pancakes. Was pretty much finished the omelette before the pancakes were served & it was only 2 pancakes and a side of syrup. The omelette was fine but nothing special. The veggies were onion and green pepper. Pretty basic. We were there first thing in the morning and there was leftover pie from the previous day. Don't know how long the other bakes have been sitting out for. Drinks took ages too. Better cheap eats in town.

Best pancakes I've had in South East Asia. Real maple syrup and whipped butter plus crispy bacon. Their baked goods look great too but now I'm too full for anything else. I'll also confirm she makes her own maple syrup!

Stopped in this morning for a coffee and a delicious mango shake. Opted for “fresh milk” instead of adding condensed milk to the shake as the mango is sweet enough as is and i must say, it was perfect! 

At that point we decided to go ahead and order a breakfast omelette and baguette and that too was very tasty.  The breakfast ingredients were very fresh.  Unfortunately the omelette was eaten before a picture could be snapped, but will tell you you can’t go wrong with whichever one you order. Would definitely eat here again.
Great food for cheap price! Nice family restaurant in the main square :)
Quiet, chill spot a few meters down from the old market. Happy shake was good.
The best food.....pizza
Decent tasting pizza but the 'happy' aspect of it did the trick. $2 of happiness was sufficient.

Nice, quiet restaurant with good food. Burgers and street tacos awesome. Lot of beer choices. Do not recommend salmon burgers. Too fishy. Music needs to be light jazz or light classical. Extremely nice staff. Accepts reservations. Prices reasonable.

We have eaten here twice and really enjoyed the experience both times. On our first trip I got a chicken sandwich with avocado and a mango salsa. That was delicious! This time I did a cup of tomato soup, a salad, and a side of fries. For the second time, the food was good and so was the service. I was surprised to see that they also offer brisket tacos from the nearby Juicy Pig BBQ restaurant.

I went in and was seated quickly, and then I gave the waiter my drink. He then quickly forgot about me and I sat silently for 15 minutes before I decided that I should probably go back to class before I’m late. If I wasn’t on a time crunch I probably would have stayed longer or tried to rectify it, but I wasn’t so fortunate. Overall a pretty negative and probably rare experience but it happened. Maybe I’ll try again if I ever feel up to it.
The greenhouse has a magnificent Aura inside. It's very cozy. The bar is mostly where I spend my time as it is very comfortable and has a relaxing setting. The food is to die for.
Ashley did a great job!  Cool place.  Nice ambiance.  Fish n chips was great.
